availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, farmer. Native of Germany. Married to Christine Neabel Metzger. Father of Rosina Metzger, Angelina Metzger, Emma Metzger, Valentine Metzger, and John Metzger. Farmer in Bracken County, Kentucky, in 1860. Operated as a grocer in space rented from George Kimberly in Bracken County from October 1, 1861, to January 1, 1862, and March 10, 1862, to December 12, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, District 1, p. 243.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Foster, p. 357A.
Find A Grave, "Valentine Metzger (August 13, 1881)," Memorial #32607778, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/32607778 (accessed April 29, 2020).
KYR-0001-004-0321.
